metadata.title: CVE-2021-2340 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Memcached). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.25 andprior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS3.1 Base Score 2.7 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-router - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.26-0ubuntu1').
